Inadequate infrastructure: The lack of adequate infrastructure such as pipelines, storage tanks, and distribution systems can make it difficult to provide clean water to the population.
Cultural barriers: Cultural beliefs and practices may prevent people from adopting new water management practices, making it difficult to implement the initiative.
Political instability: Political instability in the country can make it difficult to establish and maintain partnerships and collaborations necessary for the success of the initiative.
Climate change: Climate change can affect the availability and quality of water resources, making it more difficult to establish a clean water initiative.
Lack of awareness: Many people in developing countries may not be aware of the importance of clean water, making it difficult to gain their support and cooperation.
